content.text: Welcome to the DroneAid Assembly Guide! This interactive guide will walk you through the complete assembly process of your drone step by step.

steps.title: Prep: Unpack Frame and Clean Parts

content.text: Unpack the frame bag and group the screws on the blue mat
Wipe all parts clean of dirt with napkins (so that you don‚Äôt dirty your hands while assembling)

steps.title: Prep: Sort and Organize All Bolts

content.text: Before starting, sort all bolts by size and put it into the sorter (plastic box)

steps.title: Frame Assembly: Identify Parts and Bolt Sizes

content.text: Prepare to join shield [1] to arms [2] and to bottom frame [3].

steps.title: Frame Assembly: Insert Bolts into Bottom Plate

content.text: Inset a medium 18mm bolt and a short 16mm bolt into the bottom plate.
Place the arm onto the bolts.
Place the middle plate onto the top and screw the short 16mm bolt into it

steps.title: Frame Assembly: Install Spacers on Arms

content.text: Screw spacer onto medium 18mm bolt

steps.title: Frame Assembly: Repeat Steps for Remaining Arms

content.text: Repeat 2-4 step for all other arm
‚ö†Ô∏è Check that any of the short bolts don't stick out from the plate.
Screw 2 short 16mm boltsbetwean arms
Screw 4 long 28mm bolts in the middle part

steps.title: Frame Assembly: Corner Spacers on Middle Plate

content.text: Screw the spacers to the corners of the middle plate using 8mm bolts

steps.title: Frame Assembly: Install Front Camera Mount

content.text: Add 3d printed part for the camera in front

steps.title: Frame Assembly: Install Rear Antenna Mount

content.text: Add 3d printed part for antennas on the back
Now its time to install the motors. We have 4 motors in the package.
‚ÄºÔ∏è Attention! keep motors as far as possible away from small metal particles (screws, pieces of wires, etc ) as they can damage the motor.

steps.title: Motor Installation: Prepare Motors and Hardware

content.text: Open the package with 4 screws and a one big nut for the motor. Screw the nut onto the motor by hand to not lose it.

steps.title: Motor Installation: Check Correct Screw Length

content.text: Before installing the motors, we need to make sure that the screws are the right length. For a 10‚Äù drone, it's a 10mm screw.
‚ÄºÔ∏è We need to make sure that they do not touch the motor windings, and at the same time hold the motors firmly
After we have found the screws, we need to apply one drop of thread lock (loctite) to bolt and screw them.
Repeat it for all bolts.
Tighten all screws until thread lock will fix screws

Insert one side into the hole
Adjust so that the silicone grommets is completely in place

steps.title: FC & ESC: Install Grommets on FC

steps.title: FC & ESC: Connect Cable to ESC

content.text: Connect cable to ESC before place in place

steps.title: FC & ESC: Position ESC on Frame

content.text: Place the ESC with the power cables towards the antennas. And make sure motor cables are aligned as on the photo

steps.title: FC & ESC: Orient and Mount FC

content.text: On top of the ESC, place FC as in the photo. Arrow must look to the camera side

steps.title: FC & ESC: Plug Cable into FC

content.text: Connect cable to FC

steps.title: FC & ESC: Prepare Metal Stack Nuts

content.text: Take 4 metal nuts for the stack from the frame components

steps.title: FC & ESC: Tighten Stack with Isolation

content.text: Tighten the stack so that it stands straight, but leave enough flexibility for the silicone to compress and absorb vibrations. The bolts must touch the silicone inside the nuts
Check that all the bolts on the bottom of the board are tightened
Connect the motors cables to the stack. Make sure to use the nearest motor outputs when connecting each motor

steps.title: FC & ESC: Secure Motor Wires to Frame

content.text: Attach double-sided tape from the motor wires to the frame closer to the motors

content.text: Remove the nut from the pigtail and insert the pigtail from the underside in the 3d printed mount.

Install VTX as on a photo and screw then by 4 bolts as on a photo
Connect the pigtail to the VTX until you hear a click.

ordered_list: Cut the wire to length so that it is enough for the connecting to FS

One by one apply flux on cable and
Add tin the solder to cable to cover them

steps.title: Motor Cable Soldering: Solder Wires to Pads

content.text: Solder all thee cables to the pad
Cover by protection
The cable that connects to the TX (transmit) pad on the flight controller must be soldered to the RX (receive) pad on the receiver because they are designed to communicate with each other.
The TX pad sends data out, and the RX pad receives data.
By connecting TX to RX and RX to TX, you ensure that the data flow is correct ‚Äî the flight controller can send commands to the receiver, and the receiver can correctly interpret them.
‚ÄºÔ∏è If you connect TX to TX or RX to RX, the devices won't be able to properly exchange information.
